comments.body:
It looks like this package requires `PrettyTable`:

https://github.com/irods/python-irodsclient/blob/5f23b41cb0a619739d4b876071425614588f37e8/setup.py#L30

It looks like this package might be able to be `noarch: python`:

http://conda-forge.readthedocs.io/en/latest/meta.html#building-noarch-packages

My only concern is that the pypi meta info says "posix", so I'm not sure if there is an issue building/running this package on windows. If there is, that build should be skipped and you can't use `noarch`. If this is ok on windows, then consider using `noarch`.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +12,16 @@  sha256: {{ sha256 }}

build:
  number: 0
  script: python setup.py install --single-version-externally-managed --record record.txt
